lines.text: [first lines]
00 o'clock..." Closeup on Ace and Stuffy in the cockpit, cut to a view of the southern tip of Manhattan, and back to the cockpit]
There she is!

[blankly]
What "she" are you talkin' about? Don't tell me you see a dame this high up.

[laughing]
I'm talking about New York.

[deadpan]
Oh. Well, don't put skirts on it.
I guess there'll only be one girl in your life, eh Stuffy?

[puzzled]
Yeah? Who's that?
Polly.
Polly's different. She can't talk back.
[Polly rolls out of view as the scene fades to a ticker tape parade. Ace and Stuffy are in the back seat of an open touring car, waving at the throng, and covered with streamers and confetti]
I bet you never got this many cheers when you were a fighter, eh Stuffy?
Nah, all I ever heard was the referee countin'
And half the time you couldn't hear that.

[Stuffy gives him a dirty look]
Wave to the free people, Stuffy.
...I thought you was on the level
[with Janet]
Feed 'em, fly 'em, and forget 'em.
[Ace doesn't realize that Janet has overheard this exchange]
[Janet flies Ace to her country cottage]

[as they enter the front gate]
Nice place here.
Think so?
Yeah, but I'm getting a little jealous.
Why jealous?
I thought we were gonna be alone, and I find a flock of chickens to keep us company. Tell me, whaddya do with 'em, sweet?
I've got a system all my own.
Oh, you have, huh?
Mmm, hmm. I feed 'em, fry 'em, and forget 'em!
[last lines]
...I hope you're not mad at me.
Mad at you? I could kiss you!
[starts toward him]
You're going the wrong way.
[he turns her toward Ace. Janet and Ace kiss]
